Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with reserved dot in centre; exterior: reserved on bowl and reserved band at junction of bowl and foot; glazed streaky black below; inscription on underside with trace of black.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '34', is written in pencil on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 34)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1087) (phase 2)
